opendial.bn.distribs

Interface MultivariateDistribution

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmpiricalDistribution, MultivariateTable

    public interface MultivariateDistribution
    Representation of a multivariate probability distribution P(X1,...Xn), where X1,...Xn are random variables.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-10-16 02:10:48 #$ *
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MultivariateDistribution copy()
      Returns a copy of the distribution.
      IndependentProbDistribution getMarginal(java.lang.String variable)
      Returns the marginal probability distribution P(Xi) for a random variable Xi in X1,...Xn.
      double getProb(Assignment values)
      Returns the probability of a particular assignment of values.
      java.util.Set<Assignment> getValues()
      Returns the set of possible assignments for the random variables.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getVariables()
      Returns the names of the random variables in the distribution
      boolean isWellFormed()
      Returns true if the distribution is well-formed, and false otherwise.
      void modifyVariableId(java.lang.String oldId, java.lang.String newId)
      Modifies the variable identifier in the distribution
      void pruneValues(double threshold)
      Prunes all values assignment whose probability falls below the threshold.
      Assignment sample()
      Returns a sample assignment for X1,...Xn.
      MultivariateTable toDiscrete()
      Returns a representation of the distribution as a multivariate table.

      • getVariables

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getVariables()
        Returns the names of the random variables in the distribution
        Returns:
        the set of variable names.

      • getValues

        java.util.Set<Assignment> getValues()
        Returns the set of possible assignments for the random variables.
        Returns:
        the set of possible assignment

      • getProb

        double getProb(Assignment values)
        Returns the probability of a particular assignment of values.
        Parameters:
        values - the assignment of values to X1,...Xn.
        Returns:
        the corresponding probability

      • sample

        Assignment sample()
           throws DialException
        Returns a sample assignment for X1,...Xn.
        Returns:
        the sampled assignment
        Throws:
        DialException - if no sample could be extracted

      • getMarginal

        IndependentProbDistribution getMarginal(java.lang.String variable)
        Returns the marginal probability distribution P(Xi) for a random variable Xi in X1,...Xn.
        Parameters:
        variable - the random variable Xi
        Returns:
        the marginal distribution P(Xi)

      • modifyVariableId

        void modifyVariableId(java.lang.String oldId,
                      java.lang.String newId)
        Modifies the variable identifier in the distribution
        Parameters:
        oldId - the old identifier
        newId - the new identifier

      • toDiscrete

        MultivariateTable toDiscrete()
        Returns a representation of the distribution as a multivariate table.
        Returns:
        the multivariate table.

      • isWellFormed

        boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true if the distribution is well-formed, and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if well-formed, else false.

      • copy

        MultivariateDistribution copy()
        Returns a copy of the distribution.
        Returns:
        the copy.

      • pruneValues

        void pruneValues(double threshold)
        Prunes all values assignment whose probability falls below the threshold.
        Parameters:
        threshold - the threshold to apply
